name: Hotel am Konzerthaus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel on Jan 2011 with my wife for 6 nights and everything was great. The reception staff was friendly and eager to help (from directions for public transport to recommendations for restaurants). The service was very good and we didn't face any problems (they also changed a light bulb in the bathroom which was out when we got there and which we always forgot to mention to them). The breakfast was very good and there was a big variety to choose from with frequent refills. Heating was good on the 5th floor and although our room was facing the main street it was quiet. The Wi-Fi code we were given was valid for all days and not for 1hr, so we enjoyed the fast internet connection they have. The cleaning service was ok and the room was very spacious (especially the king size bed). The location is excellent, it's 10-15 minutes walk from the city center, a couple of minutes from the Underground stop (Staadpark), there is a bus stop opposite the hotel and there are tram stops for the main lines (1 & 2) one block away. It's not really in the center but it has the advantage that it's quiet. When we visit Vienna again we'll have it on our list.
reviews.title: Ideal and clean hotel, good location, friendly staff.
January 2011 in Vienna
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Konzerthaus for 6 nights. The hotel and the rooms were very clean, the location was very convenient not far from the underground station and within 15 minutes walk from the city center.
The staff at the reception were very friendly and helpful (they also recommended us a very good restaurant to go and we really enjoyed the food there, Salm Brau close to the Belvedere).
reviews.title: Nice and cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very good, check if it is included in the room price because otherwise it is quite expensive.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Hotel Am Konzerthaus for two nights after Christmas. We liked the hotel location and helpful front desk personnel. Our Superior room was a bit small for its class, especially the king size bed. However, our room was quiet and the free mineral water and tee/coffee machine were appreciated.
reviews.title: Hotel with good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the room's worn-down feeling left us slightly disappointed (they would've changed the room next day but we didn't bother the extra fuzz), but hotel location, friendly service and good lounge/bar made the stay rather nice. Considering Vienna hotel prices overall, Hotel am Konzerthaus price-quality ratio is good if not even very good.
reviews.title: Good hotel, recommendable, but not without flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here only one night, and it was no doubt a good experience overall, but not as good as you'd expect in a hotel of this level and price. So, our mixed impressions are the following:
reviews.title: A Fabulous Stay

reviews.text: We paid for the most expensive room in the hotel, which we didn't initially get. So, instead of the Deluxe Room, we got a Superior, which was much smaller, had a smaller bed, and didn't have some benefits that the upper class one had. When we complained they first told us that all rooms have been redecorated (?), but then realized the problem and moved us to the room which corresponded us. It's worth mentioning that they were very friendly all the time, though.
reviews.title: One of the best choices to stay in Vienna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here over Christmas (our first away from family) and the hotel didn't disappoint. In fact, the excellent service and relaxing ambiance made us feel very at home over the festive period. The decor is beautiful and distinctive; background music is unobtrusive and relaxing; the breakfast was superb. Our room ( a deluxe suite) was spacious, comfortable and elegant, with wonderful L'Occitane toiletries. The location is excellent ( less then ten minutes walk from Stephandom). We ate in the hotel restaurant one evening, and while the food was good,the overall meal was a little inconsistent. Despite this one point, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this unique hotel and would not hesistate to recommend it.
reviews.title: Elegance and Calm in the heart of Vienna

reviews.text: This is a great city centre hotel with original, well-designed rooms, good space for working and a warm welcome.
reviews.title: Great city centre hotel for business

reviews.text: Very nice hotel, top location in Vienna for a good price. Breakfast is very good. Rooms are nice. The only downsides are the restaurant, which is not as good as expected (especially given the good food in Vienna) and some of the staff are a little snobby. Most are very service minded though.
reviews.title: solid trendy hotel, with nice rooms, but restaurant below expectations

reviews.text: Spend December 20-29, 2010 at Hotel am Konzerthaus. You might describe the establishment as a 'boutique hotel' as it possessed an understated decor and quiet charm. The room designers were cleaver to pull in native son Klimt's works to adorn the rooms (picture attached) and all amenities were of top quality. The staff presented themselves in full professionalism from dress to demeanor, never missing an opportunity to smile or speak to me. The room was quite spacious and clean and the window did open to allow fresh air in. All points of interest were within easy walking distance. There was a taxi stand on the corner and a market a block away. Hotel am Konzerthaus served as a nice 'home away from home' for the traveling explorer.
reviews.title: Convenient but Quiet Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though the hotel rooms could use a redo, Hotel am Konzerthaus was a very good choice in Vienna. The service was simply superb (the reception staff was really nice and welcoming!), the breakfast was very good, the hotel was conveniently located, and the room was quiet and comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay, and have already recommended this hotel to some friends.
reviews.title: Excellent service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic all around! The staff were really friendly and helpful and spoke excellent english which was great. The rooms were much nicer than in the photos and were in really good shape. The bed though is really what made the hotel for me. It's an actual king size bed and it was SOOOOO comfy with tons of pillows and this great comforter...it was heaven. Best sleep I've had in a hotel in a long time. Plus it didn't hurt that there was free breakfast in the mornings with a great selection. You have to pay for internet in your rooms but there are 2 computers you can use for free in the lobby. The location of the hotel was perfect for walking to most of the main areas. We rarely had to take a tram to go anywhere. That was definitely nice. The hotel was really quiet, you rarely heard hallway noise and we never heard street noise. My only "complaint" is that they scent their hallways too much, that got annoying but other than that this hotel is close to perfect. Definitely stay here!
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I booked a City Break in Vienna with AA Getaways who managed our booking and various travel requests very well indeed. This was our first visit to Vienna so didn't really have many expectations other than a comfortable hotel with easy walking access to the City Centre. We stayed at the Hotel am Konzerthaus in the Embassy district. The Hotel, in a very good and safe location, more than matched our expectations! During our entire stay the Reception Team were truly courteous, professional, fun, friendly and happy to assist with our numerous enquiries regarding directions; places to eat; how to get from the hotel to a specific place; suggestions for restaurants etc. Nothing was too much trouble and their knowledge of the English language is very good. (Much better than our German). We upgraded to a Superior Double room which was very clean, comfortable, well appointed and stocked with excellent toiletries (L'Occitane). Overall we thought the hotel excellent and represented very good value for money. We will definitely return there with confidence.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel in an excellent location in an excellent City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy check in, good size rooms, great pillows, clean and quiet. Just what we needed for a weekend stay in Vienna during the Christmas market. The rooms look exactly like in the pictures, maybe even a bit better. Great value.
reviews.title: A decent hotel for a weekend in Vienna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can say that our New Year eve and the first week of 2011 were bedighted by the stay in Am Konzerthaus. The hotel is very comfortable and homely. Our room 532 was faced in the inner yard so our stay was very quite (noise insulation in the hotel and between rooms is good indeed too).
reviews.title: Good value, good location, good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oscar restaurant and bar is good (but the breakfast was samey).
reviews.title: It`s to good to be true

description: The Hotel am Konzerthaus Vienna by MGallery is located in the enchanting center of Vienna. Take in the legacy of the Art Nouveau era and discover famous sights in the vicinity, such as the Ringstrasse, the State Opera House, the Belvedere that holds "TheKiss" by Gustav Klimt, Vienna city park and the Vienna Secession. The hotel combines comfortable surroundings with a unique Art Nouveau character. Relax in a Superior or Deluxe room.
